sen.j: 目安箱（めやすばこ）は施政の参考意見や社会事情の収集などを目的に、庶民の進言の投書を集めるために設置した箱、及びその制度の事である。
sen.e: Meyasubako was a box which was established to collect letters of proposal by the common people for the purpose of collecting opinions about administrative policies and information about the society, or the system thereof.

Meyasubako was a box which was set up to collect letters of proposal by the common people for the purpose of collecting opinions about administrative policies and information about the society, or the system thereof.
sen.cmt: 「箱の設置」は具体的な物ですので、establishではなくset upが適切と思われます。
sen.e: Meyasubako was a box which was set up to collect letters of proposal by the common people for the purpose of collecting opinions about administrative policies and information about the society, or the system thereof.

sen.j: 制度自体は古くから存在し、室町時代には戦国大名北条氏康がこの制度を実施していた。
sen.e: The system itself existed for a long period of time, and in Muromachi period, Ujiyasu HOJO, a daimyo in the Sengoku period, conducted this system.
The system itself existed for a long period of time, and in the Muromachi period, Ujiyasu HOJO, a daimyo in the Sengoku period, implemented this system.
sen.cmt: ・Muromachi periodに冠詞を付けました。・systemはconductすることができないため、implementに変更しました。
sen.e: The system itself existed for a long period of time, and in the Muromachi period, Ujiyasu HOJO, a daimyo in the Sengoku period, implemented this system.

sen.j: ただし、一般的に目安箱といえば江戸時代に徳川吉宗が設置したものを指すことが多い。
sen.e: However, generally speaking, meyasubako means the system established by Yoshimune TOKUGAWA in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 吉宗は1721年に江戸城辰ノ口の評定所前（現在の東京駅北口付近）に毎月2日､11日､21日の月3回設置し、回収した。
sen.e: Yoshimune set the box in front of the Hyojosho (conference chamber) in Tatsunokuchi, Edo-jo Castle (around the north exit of the Tokyo station at present) on 2nd, 11th, 21st day of every month in 1721and collected proposals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1721, Yoshimune set the box in front of the Hyojosho (conference chamber) in Tatsunokuchi, Edo-jo Castle (around the north exit of the Tokyo station at present) on 2nd, 11th, and 21st days of every month to collect proposals.
sen.cmt: ・年号が一部分にしか係っていませんが、後半にも係ると思われるため、位置を変えました。・dayを複数形にしました。・箱の設置は訴状の回収が目的になるため、collectedはandではなくtoでつなげました。
sen.e: In 1721, Yoshimune set the box in front of the Hyojosho (conference chamber) in Tatsunokuchi, Edo-jo Castle (around the north exit of the Tokyo station at present) on 2nd, 11th, and 21st days of every month to collect proposals.

sen.j: 目安とは訴状のことであり、政治・経済から日常の問題まで、町人や農民などの要望や不満を人々に直訴させた。
sen.e: Meyasu means petition, and he let townspeople and farmers to petition requests and complaints regarding politics, economy and other issues in their daily lives.

sen.j: 幕臣の投書は当初許可されていたが間もなく禁止された。
sen.e: At first letters of proposal by shogun's retainers were allowed, but soon prohibited.

sen.j: 投書は住所・氏名記入式で、それの無い訴状は破棄された。
sen.e: It was required to write name and address of the person who made the proposal, and letters without those information were discarded.

sen.e: The box was locked and Shogun himself checked the letters inside.

sen.j: これにより、町医者の小川笙船が江戸の貧民の窮状を訴えて施療院を建てさせる進言をした。
sen.e: Thanks to this system, a town doctor Shosen OGAWA complained about the distress of the poor citizens in Edo and proposed to built a hospital.

sen.j: 吉宗が大岡忠相に検討させて小石川養生所の設置が実現した。
sen.e: Yoshimune let Tadasuke Ooka consider this proposal and the establishment of Koishikawa Hospital was realized.

sen.j: 他、町火消が整備され、幕府が行っていた新田開発では、開発可能地の意見も参考にされた。
sen.e: Also, fire brigade was implemented and opinions about possible field for new development were taken into consideration regarding development of new field.

sen.e: Also, fire brigade was organized, and in the rice field development conducted by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), opinions about possible rice fields were taken into consideration.
sen.cmt: ・brigadeをimplementすることはできないため、organizeとしました。・後半の文章の流れが逆になっていることでわかりにくいため修正しました。

sen.j: 吉宗が紀州藩主時代に和歌山城一の橋御門前に設置した訴訟箱が目安箱に繋がったと言われる。
sen.e: It is said that the soshobako which was established in front of 一の橋御門 of Wakayama-jo Castle when Yoshimune was the lord of the Kishu domain was the origin of meyasubako.
